content: simple brioche beanie a simple beginner friendly brioche pattern for a slouchy and cosy beanie with a folded up brim and a big fluffy pompom written for one adult size - the stretchy nature of the brioche stitch means it will comfortably fit most head sizes materials yarn - 1x john arbon textiles pure elements dk 250m/100g or 4x 25g or any other dk yarn needles - 3 75mm circular needles or dpns pompom maker tapestry needle stitch marker knit from the bottom up with stretch cast on single colour brioche and decreases at the crown sample shown in pure elements dk mini gradient set on 58 5cm/23 head key ** - repeats stitches between 1x1 rib - k1 p1 brk - brioche knit stitch - knit the st with its yo brp - brioche purl stitch - purl the st with its yo cc - contrast colour k - knit k2tog - knit 2 sts together mc - main colour p - purl psso - pass slipped st over s1yo - with yarn in front slip 1 st and yarn over the slipped st these are worked as 1 st in next round st s - stitch es ©helena timms 2022 gauge and measurements step 1 work 2 row in 2nd colour step 2 work 4 row in first colour the hat measures approx 48 cm/18 wide step 3 work 4 row in 2nd colour and 26 5cm/10 5 long step 4 work 2 row in first colour step 5 break first colour gauge 18 sts and 46 rounds in brioche pattern in 10cm/4 continue in brioche pattern in cc2 for 24 row pattern repeat the 5-step colour change pattern with if working a single colour version follow cc2 as first colour and cc3 as 2nd colour instructions for mc if using 4 mini skeins follow gradient version continue in brioche pattern in cc3 for 24 row set up repeat the 5-step colour change pattern with all versions cc3 as first colour and cc4 as 2nd colour cast on 84sts using tubular cast on* or continue in brioche pattern in cc4 for 6 row stretchy cast on of your choice using cc1 or mc place marker and join to work in the decreases round all versions work 2 set up row for tubular cast on or 1 row in 1x1 rib if using a different cast on round 1 *slip brk k2tog p and brk psso s1yo brk s1yo* repeat to end 28sts *there are many tubular cast on tutorials decreased 56sts remaining available online if you are unfamiliar with this method rounds 2-6 work 5 row as normal starting with a round 4 round 1 *k1 s1yo* repeat to end round 2 *s1yo brp* repeat to end round 7 *slip brk k2tog p and brk psso s1yo* repeat to end 28sts decreased 28sts brioche pattern repeat remaining round 3 *brk s1yo* repeat to end round 8 *s1yo brp* repeat to end round 4 *s1yo brp* repeat to end
